author: James Tanner
method: Cut slits in the squid flesh to make a criss-cross pattern. Drizzle with oil and the lime juice and sprinkle with a pinch of chilli flakes. Leave to marinate for a few minutes (or longer if time allows). Heat a griddle pan until hot. Griddle the squid for 1-2 minutes on each side. Place the couscous in a bowl and stir in the lemon juice, seasoning, dill and pine nuts.  Spoon onto a serving plate and serve the squid on top.
ingredients: Â½ squid, cleaned,  drizzle of oil,  squeeze of lime juice,  pinch of chilli flakes,  85g/3oz cooked couscous (cooked weight),  1 lemon, juice only,  salt and freshly ground black pepper,  handful of dill,  55g/2oz pine nuts, toasted
